You have forgotten the American Empire, witch for all intensive purposes 
was and is an Empire. It reached its territorial peek in 1898 of  9,800,000 
sq/km. Canada can also fall under the description of an Empire with close 
to 10,000,000 sq/km. There are a number of other states that have existed 
larger then some of the ones u listed; such as communist controlled China, 
Hapsburg controlled land, and the USSR, to name a few. However, what most 
of these different empires have in common as that they are just government 
changes within an already existing empire or the conquest of said empire by 
a relative small power. In such cases the conqueror generally adapts the 
political institutions and problem of its forbears. A examples of this is 
Alexander's Empire, the USSR and Yuan dynasty in China. To this one could 
argue that the empire in itself is not changing but instead the bureaucracy 
and administration. ﻿

that ancient Macedonians did not consider themselves Greek. The Greek 
city-states (since no actual GREEK entity existed) looked down on the 
Macedonians as less-than-Greek barbarous people. The Macedonians disagreed.

throughout the old world, from Egypt to the Middle East, and into the
